intro: Chamaecrista cupeyalensis, commonly known as the Cupeyal or Yellow Caper, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and can be used in traditional medicine, while its flowers attract various pollinators. The plant's adaptability and ornamental value make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
